Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, this film depicts our social history at the beginning of the Showa period when the ideological rule of Imperial Japan collapsed. If you are a fan of Zorro, Indiana Jones, or action in general this is a must-see. Directed by Republic's ace team of William Witney and John English and starring John Carroll, Eric Campbell, and George J. Lewis, Saved by the Badman is sure to provide a brilliant weekend of entertainment.
Indian Village--Long before European 'cowboys' ruled, the American West was wild and populated by Indians affected by the encroachment on their land

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The cat, left to fend for itself when its owners move away, has taken to killing the local livestock, and endangering small children and pets.
Production Company : New Line Cinema, Largo Entertainment
